revised_title: Initiation and Growth of Explosion in Solids: Part I - Initiation of Explosion by Light
tldr: The authors discuss the initiation and growth of explosions in solids, focusing on the initiation of explosions by light. They demonstrate that a large number of explosion primers can be caused to detonate by brief irradiation with sparks from energetic electric discharges. The initiation is mainly due to the sudden heating of the compounds, resulting in a photothermic effect.
